text: Nevada Question 6 is a plan to change the law in Nevada to protect the right to an abortion. This new law would allow people to get an abortion until a baby can survive outside the womb, which is usually around 23 or 24 weeks. It also lets doctors help if the pregnant personâ€™s life or health is in danger. People in Nevada voted on this law change in the election on November 5, 2024. The law change was approved by 64% of people who could voted in the November 5th election, which means that the right to abortion is protected Nevada. Voters will need to vote again on November 3, 2026. == References == Category:United States law
title: 2024 Nevada question 6
